moj.granska
Class GranskaConnection

java.lang.Object
  moj.granska.GranskaConnection
public class GranskaConnection
extends Object

GranskaConnection handles all communication with a Granska server. So far, only tokenizing, lemmatizing, tagging, parsing and grammar checking is only available for Swedish text input. Parts of this class where derived from the Grim project with special thanks to Stefan Westlund.

Version:
2004-may-21
Author:
Martin Hassel

Constructor Detail

GranskaConnection

public GranskaConnection(String host,
                         int port,
                         String path)
                  throws MalformedURLException
Create a new GranskaConnection to the given host at the given port and path.

Parameters:
host - Granska server host to connect to.
port - port on Granska server to connect to.
path - path to the servlets on the Granska server.

GranskaConnection

public GranskaConnection()
                  throws MalformedURLException
Create a new GranskaConnection to the Granska Server given in Granska.properties.

Method Detail

getDefaultProperties

public static Properties getDefaultProperties()
Get default Granska connection properties for connecting to the Granska server at KTH NADA.

Returns:
properties object containing the default Granska connection info for connecting to the Granska server at KTH NADA.

scrutinize

public InputSource scrutinize(String text)
Sends the text text to the Granska server and returns an InputSource "pointing" at the scrutinized text. The returned XML-document contains information about lemmas and pos-tags of words as well as possible grammar errors.

Parameters:
text - the text that is to be scrutinized by the Granska server.
Returns:
an InputSource, for example to be passed to a XMLReader.

parse

public InputSource parse(String text)
Sends the text text to the Granska server and returns an InputSource "pointing" at the parsed text. The returned XML-document contains information about lemmas and pos-tags of words as well as phrase structure information.

Parameters:
text - the text that is to be parsed by the Granska server.
Returns:
an InputSource, for example to be passed to a XMLReader.

tokenize

public String tokenize(String text)
Tokenizes the given text. The tokens (words, delimiters etc.) in the returned string are separated by space. For example, the text "Han springer fortare!" would yield the response "Han springer fortare ! ". Note: Processes the text until first encountered newline, following text is skipped!

Parameters:
text - the text that is to be tokenized.
Returns:
the text tokenized, or null if tokenize fails.

lemmatize

public String lemmatize(String text)
Tokenizes and lemmatizes the given text. The tokens (words, delimiters etc.) in the returned string are separated by space. For example, the text "Han springer fortare!" would yield the response "han springa fort ! ". Note: Processes the text until first encountered newline, following text is skipped!

Parameters:
text - the text that is to be tokenized and lemmatized.
Returns:
the text tokenized and lemmatized, or null if lemmatize fails.

lemmaTag

public String lemmaTag(String text)
Tokenizes, lemmatizes and pos-tags the given text. The tokens (words, delimiters etc.) in the returned string are separated by space. For example, the text "Han springer fortare!" would yield the response "han_pn springa_vb fort_ab !_mad ". Note: Processes the text until first encountered newline, following text is skipped!

Parameters:
text - the text that is to be tokenized, lemmatized and pos-tagged.
Returns:
the text tokenized, lemmatized and pos-tagged - or null if lemmaTag fails.

simpleTag

public String simpleTag(String text)
Pos-tags the given text. The tokens (words, delimiters etc.) in the returned string are separated by space. For example, the text "Han springer fortare!" would yield the response "Han_pn.utr.sin.def.sub springer_vb.prs.akt fortare_ab.kom !_mad ". Note: Processes the text until first encountered newline, following text is skipped!

Parameters:
text - the text that is to be pos-tagged.
Returns:
the text pos-tagged - or null if simpleTag fails.

inflect

public String inflect(String word)
Inflects the given word.

Parameters:
word - the word that is to be inflected.
Returns:
all inflections of the given word, no matter wordclass. Inflections are separated by newline (\n).

inflect

public String inflect(String word,
                      String wordclass)
Inflects the given word according to the paradigm of the given wordclass.

Parameters:
word - the word that is to be inflected.
wordclass - the wordclass of the word that is to be inflected.
Returns:
all inflections of the given word according to the paradigm of the given wordclass. Inflections are separated by newline (\n).

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Some example code that showcases some usages of the Granska package.

Parameters:
args - no arguments taken
